main event: Several shiny objects were observed in McDonald, Ohio, on 25 August 1949, which split into 4 or 5 pieces and floated upward.
interesting points: The objects were described as glittering and flopping in the sun,The event was mistaken for 'flying saucers' by local residents,Tom Luarde, a 14-year-old witness, was the first to report the sighting to others,The shiny objects were later identified as bits of silver paper burned from a cleaning operation at the Carnegie-Illinois Steel Plant,The Air Force offices were involved after the incident was reported.
sighted object: shiny objects that appeared in the sky
